content:
Hi all, new to FHIR here. I was wondering if there is a way to get pregnancy related information using FHIR. Things like gestational age for instance.

Thanks!

Please see the preganacy related profiles in the Electronic Case Reporting IGs: Published: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/ecr/profiles.html and a version Undergoing ballot reconciliation from January 2021 ballot: http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/case-reporting/
@Shamil - no those are the correct links
I'm not about links. I'm about the pregnancy related info.
OK - but more specifically - it is well defined in the IG I referenced and should be used - its all about doing things the same wherever possible :-)

Right. Gestational age would be an Observation. Most of the data in a pregnancy record will be Observations. However, there'll be some MedicationAdministrations, Immunizations, Procedures and other things too. Systems can (though not many do) link all information related to a particular Pregnancy using EpisodeOfCare and the extension that allows linking various resources to it.
There are a few pregnancy related profiles in the, still draft, Australian National Child Digital Health Implementation Guide @Shovan Roy

We have few R4 profiles in here: http://build.fhir.org/ig/hl7au/au-fhir-childhealth/branches/au-fhir-ch-r4/profiles-dphr.html
more to come..

A lot of pregnancy related profiles in:
Birth and fetal death reporting (in ballot) - https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-bfdr/index.html
Common Public Health profiles library (in ballot) - http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-vr-common-ig/branches/master/index.html
Birth Defect Reporting (just a draft but will be balloted) - https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-birthdefectsreporting-ig/
